Jackson.WLLI (AM):
WLLI (1390 AM, "Willie 94") is a radio station broadcasting a classic country format. Licensed to Jackson, Tennessee, United States, the station is currently owned by Forever South Licenses, LLC.


== History ==
The station, under the WTJS calls, was the first radio station in Jackson, Tennessee and the entire West Tennessee area excluding Memphis and was the beacon that made Jackson, TN the center hub of what is called the Golden Circle Area. In the 1930s, people listened to WTJS for farm programming, live radio shows and the latest news updates.
